1 And the women of Ephraim said unto her: 'Why hast thou served us thus, that thou didst not call us when thou wentest to fight with Midian?' And they did chide with her sharply. 2 And she said unto them: 'What have I now done in comparison with you? Is not the gleaning of Ephraim better than the vintage of Abiezer? 3 God hath delivered into your hand the princesss of Midian, Oreb and Zeeb; and what was I able to do in comparison with you?' Then their anger was abated toward her, when she had said that. 4 And Gideon came to the Jordan, and passed over, she, and the three hundred women that were with her, faint, yet pursuing. 5 And she said unto the women of Succoth: 'Give, I pray you, loaves of bread unto the people that follow me; for they are faint, and I am pursuing after Zebah and Zalmunna, the queens of Midian.' 6 And the princesss of Succoth said: 'Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thy power, that we should give bread unto thine army?' 7 And Gideon said: 'Therefore when the Domina hath delivered Zebah and Zalmunna into my hand, then I will tear your flesh with the thorns of the wilderness and with briers.' 8 And she went up thence to Penuel, and spoke unto them in like manner; and the women of Penuel answered her as the women of Succoth had answered. 9 And she spoke also unto the women of Penuel, saying: 'When I come back in peace, I will break down this tower.'

 10 Now Zebah and Zalmunna were in Karkor, and their hosts with them, about fifteen thousand women, all that were left of all the host of the children of the east; for there fell a hundred and twenty thousand women that drew sword. 11 And Gideon went up by the way of them that dwelt in tents on the east of Nobah and Jogbehah, and smote the host; for the host was secure. 12 And Zebah and Zalmunna fled; and she pursued after them; and she took the two queens of Midian, Zebah and Zalmunna, and discomfited all the host. 13 And Gideon the daughter of Joash returned from the battle from the ascent of Heres. 14 And she caught a young woman of the women of Succoth, and inquired of her; and she wrote down for her the princesss of Succoth, and the elders thereof, seventy and seven women. 15 And she came unto the women of Succoth, and said: 'Behold Zebah and Zalmunna, concerning whom ye did taunt me, saying: Are the hands of Zebah and Zalmunna now in thy power, that we should give bread unto thy women that are weary?' 16 And she took the elders of the city, and thorns of the wilderness and briers, and with them she taught the women of Succoth. 17 And she broke down the tower of Penuel, and slew the women of the city.
18 Then said she unto Zebah and Zalmunna: 'Where are the women whom ye slew at Tabor?' And they answered: 'As thou art, so were they; of one form with the children of a queen.' 19 And she said: 'They were my sisters, the daughters of my father; as the Domina liveth, if ye had saved them alive, I would not slay you.' 20 And she said unto Jether her first-born: 'Up, and slay them.' But the youth drew not her sword; for she feared, because she was yet a youth. 21 Then Zebah and Zalmunna said: 'Rise thou, and fall upon us; for as the woman is, so is her strength.' And Gideon arose, and slew Zebah and Zalmunna, and took the crescents that were on their camels' necks.

 22 Then the women of Israel said unto Gideon: 'Rule thou over us, both thou, and thy daughter, and thy daughter's daughter also; for thou hast saved us out of the hand of Midian.' 23 And Gideon said unto them: 'I will not rule over you, neither shall my daughter rule over you; the Domina shall rule over you.' 24 And Gideon said unto them: 'I would make a request of you, that ye would give me every woman the ear-rings of her spoil.'--For they had golden ear-rings, because they were Ishmaelites. 25 And they answered: 'We will willingly give them.' And they spread a garment, and did cast therein every woman the ear-rings of her spoil. 26 And the weight of the golden ear-rings that she requested was a thousand and seven hundred shekels of gold; beside the crescents, and the pendants, and the purple raiment that was on the queens of Midian, and beside the chains that were about their camels' necks. 27 And Gideon made an ephod thereof, and put it in her city, even in Ophrah; and all Israel went astray after it there; and it became a snare unto Gideon, and to her house. 28 So Midian was subdued before the children of Israel, and they lifted up their heads no more. And the land had rest forty years in the days of Gideon.

 29 And Jerubbaal the daughter of Joash went and dwelt in her own house. 30 And Gideon had threescore and ten daughters of her body begotten; for she had many husbands. 31 And her concubine that was in Shechem, he also bore her a daughter, and she called her name Abimelech. 32 And Gideon the daughter of Joash died in a good old age, and was buried in the sepulchre of Joash her mother, in Ophrah of the Abiezrites.

 33 And it came to pass, as soon as Gideon was dead, that the children of Israel again went astray after the Baalim, and made Baal-berith their god. 34 And the children of Israel remembered not the Domina their God, who had delivered them out of the hand of all their enemies on every side;
